content.prompt: Complete the following program that checks three integers, representing a date: month, day, and year. The month, day and year values are already set to variables month, day, and year respectively. You can assume that the values of these variables are always valid. For the program to work correctly, you only need to update the current values of month, day and year variables to the next day's date. E.g. 1: If the given three integers (month day year) are 3 30 2015 which represents the actual date March 30, 2015, the next day's date is 3 31 2015 (March 31, 2015) .  E.g. 2: If the given three integers (month day year) are 12 31 2016 which represents the actual date December 31, 2016, the next day's date is 1 1 2017 (January 1, 2017). Hint 1: Do not forget to consider the leap year. If the current year is a leap year and the current date given is 02 28 1988, the next day's date becomes 02 29 1988 instead of 03 01 1988In the Gregorian calendar, a year is a leap year when the number representing that year is divisible by 4, but not by 100, unless it is divisible by 400. Hint 2: Assume that there are no leap years before 1582.Authors: Yana Kortsarts, Yulia Kempner, Leonid Kugel, Kamil Akhuseyinoglu
